question: The deadline of a project I am working on is approaching. I decide to work longer and harder to deliver it on time with a good quality, instead of rushing through some parts.
I decide to go to Starbucks to get my daily latte. Somehow, there is a huge and long queue in front of me. I decide to be patient instead of trying to cut the line or find a shortcut.
When I am feeling creative, I usually enjoy drawing / scheming my ideas.
I like to spend time alone with my thoughts, rather than sharing them directly with others.
I like to engage in social gatherings, and feel like I communicate well with people from different backgrounds.
I enjoy working with theories and hypotheses.
I don't feel confused when working on multiple tasks simultaniously.
The lights of my fridge stop working. I would rather fix them myself than call an electrician.
I don't find performing scientific research boring.
I am not easily convinced by what others tell me unless I have a look at it myself.
Winning a robotics competition is more relevant than winning a coding only competition.
If I was working as a salesman, I would probably know how to sell you this pen.
When I find myself under high-pressure, or facing conflicts, I may seem introverted.
One day I want to have a private workbench at home.
I am environmentally conscious and I usually try to save resources such as water and power.
I want to spend more time working on a task than on discussing it.
My team is working on a smart smoke detector. Everyone must work on both hardware and software aspects of the project, but I think I can contribute better if I spend more time on the hardware part.
When using my computer, driving my car, watching my TV or listening to music through my headphones, I sometimes wonder how these devices work.
I would be more confortable working outside and being present on a project's field than working in a closed office.
When I play a video game, watch a youtube video or use social media, I sometimes wonder how that works behind the scenes.
I enjoy courses about circuits, electricity, and operating systems.
I enjoy courses about electricity, physics, chemistry and lab experiments.
I enjoy courses about programming and conceptualization.
